title: Attention is All You Need
summary: This paper introduces the Transformer model, a novel architecture for sequence-to-sequence tasks that eliminates recurrent networks, using attention mechanisms to process input data in parallel, greatly improving efficiency in natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

title: MapReduce: Simplified Data Processing on Large Clusters
summary: Introduces the MapReduce programming model for processing large datasets in a distributed manner, simplifying parallel computation by dividing tasks into 'Map' and 'Reduce' phases, and handling fault tolerance through replication.

title: Dynamo: Amazon's Highly Available Key-value Store
summary: Dynamo is a distributed key-value store designed to support Amazon's high-availability and fault-tolerant needs, ensuring data consistency in large-scale systems while allowing for eventual consistency to maximize availability.

title: Cassandra: A Decentralized Structured Storage System
summary: Cassandra is a highly scalable and decentralized NoSQL database system designed to handle large amounts of data across many servers with no single point of failure, providing high availability and fault tolerance.

title: Kafka: A Distributed Streaming Platform
summary: Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform designed for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications. It allows for high throughput, fault tolerance, and scalability in data processing systems.

title: Bigtable: A Distributed Storage System for Structured Data
summary: Bigtable is a distributed storage system for managing structured data, providing scalability and performance for large-scale applications like search and analytics. It powers Google's services and offers high availability and low latency.

title: The Google File System
summary: The Google File System (GFS) is a scalable distributed file system designed to handle large data sets. It provides fault tolerance and efficient access to data across large clusters, supporting Google’s massive data processing needs.

title: ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge
summary: ImageNet LSVRC is a large-scale image classification challenge that has been instrumental in advancing deep learning techniques for computer vision, highlighting significant improvements in image recognition.

title: Efficiently Checking the Correctness of Programs with Interacting Pairs
summary: This paper presents a method for checking the correctness of parallel programs by examining pairs of interacting processes, offering an efficient approach for verifying concurrent software systems.

title: Randomized Algorithms for Verifying Polynomial Identities
summary: Introduces a randomized algorithm for verifying polynomial identities, offering efficient methods for algebraic verification with probabilistic guarantees.

title: Practical Algorithms for Large-scale Data Clustering
summary: This paper discusses practical algorithms for clustering massive datasets efficiently, addressing challenges of scalability and memory usage in high-dimensional spaces.

title: The Computational Complexity of Graph Partitioning
summary: This paper studies the computational complexity of graph partitioning, offering insights into algorithmic approaches and the inherent difficulty of partitioning large graphs.
